data.title: Bill is the best !! He made use sandwiches and brought them to us at the Muse cocktail bar !
data.text:
The sandwiches were beyond delicious !! Though I see Bill offers a diverse menu. MY Pastrami Ruben was fresh, lean and delicious! And his slow roasted house made pulled pork panini with homemade bbq sauce - Unbelievable! Must have with the home made Coleslaw and provolone ! Directly across from the theater ! 
Bill know how to take care of a discerning yet hungry crowd! We will be back and bring all our friends😊!

data.title: Great food!
data.text: The food was very good, but slightly more expensive than I thought it should be.  For example, salads had to be purchased separately from the entree, which added another $6.00 each for our meals.  The service was a little slow, but they were pretty busy.  We were given an appetizer for free that was excellent.  Overall, we were happy with everything.

owner_response.author: jeanette h, Owner at Theatre Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you Jackie, for your kind review. It was my pleasure meeting you and your dining partner. Glad you enjoyed the Amuse-Bouche to start out your dining experience with us....they seemed to be a big hit with all the diners.   We hope you join us again for another fun-filled show night!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hidden Jewel!
data.text: From the moment we stepped in the door until we walked out with cake and coffee to go, it was a meal to remember! We were so surprised with the amuse-bouche - what a fun start! The remoulade for the crab cakes was amazing, and the saffron in the lobster raviolis gave it such a fresh, bright taste! We've stopped ordering steak tips in restaurants because they have been such a disappointment lately. We decided to take a risk last night, and are so glad we did! They were melt in your mouth tender! We also loved the herbs in the French onion soup. After 2 appetizers, a salad, 2 entrees, 4 desserts and 4 coffees to go, we couldn't believe the bill was so low! The portions were very generous, and we would have paid double the price in Boston. All of the people who were working last night seemed to have a great time, and it felt like we were dining with family, even though it was our first time. Thank you so much for everything - we can't wait to come back!

owner_response.author: jeanette h, Owner at Theatre Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you very much, Melissa for your kind review. It was a great pleasure waiting on your table and seeing how much you enjoyed your time there. We hope you join us again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great fresh food friendly hosts
data.text: Ate breakfast  most days during a 10 day stay.. Bill and Jeanette are great friendly folk.. Nothing is too much trouble and they introduced me to several interesting meals.. Helped me find my way around and told me how to keep safe.. Food was lovely and fresh.. Wonderful varied food with fresh ingredients.

data.title: Dinner & A show
data.text: Tiny place and very good food. No alcohol offered but it's ok to bring your own. The waitress was polite, funny and hard working. It's right across the street from the Hanover Theater and have no worries they will get you out the door before your show.

data.title: Pre-Theater Dinner
data.text: Tucked away on Main Street, a block from The Hanover Theater, six members of our family dining before attending a performance tonight. And there simply aren't enough superlatives to describe our meals, all six of them superb!! From salmon, to salads, a seafood medley and lobster roll, with chunks of lobster that I haven't seen in any offering of its like anywhere!! I suspect the secret is out and getting a table there will be a challenge in the future but get there early enough so you can enjoy yourselves. We almost didn't make the theater!! Kudos to Bill and Jenette!!

data.title: Almost perfect place near the Hanover Theatre
data.text: Theatre Cafe is kind of like the inside secret you need to be in the know to visit on theater nights. People with season tickets to the Hanover get series-long reservations for theater nights. Only one reservation is taken per talbe per night, so walk-ins don't happen and openings are precious. We were lucky enough to be invited by someone with a standing reservation and the food was excellent. The menu changes every month, so if you had the protein previously, the sauce or preparation will be different. We were seated in the small, back room, which we were told can be quite tight. After an amuse bouche of duck sausage and pulled pork on mashed potatoes, the entrees arrived. I had perfectly roasted duck with crisp as glass skin and moist meat, paired with a cranberry-fig  reduction. My husband had the chicken cordon bleu, which they somehow made light. The other two companions had prime rib (they were able to accommodate an end cut) and lamb. For dessert, we shared a light and lovely lemon cake. While we have heard that sometimes service can be slower, the pace was relaxed for us and we made it to the theater (a two-minute walk) with time to spare before curtain time.

data.title: It could be perfect....
data.text:
This place was recommended as a good pre-theatre place for dinner so we decided to give it a try.

First of all, reservations are a MUST!!  There were many people who walked in and didn't stand a chance as all tables had been reserved.

I'm a real fan of holes-in-the-wall and understated places that provide amazing experiences.  This place could have been one of my all-time "finds" but just missed the mark.  It was so small that they crammed tables incredibly close together in order to get as many customers in to the space as possible.  It was uncomfortably close - so much so that you felt as though you were a guest at the other tables.  In a couple of cases, the waitstaff had difficulty getting in between them. 

There was also no space or real buffer at the door so every time the door opened a blast of cold air blew into the place.  I was so cold I kept my coat wrapped around me the entire time.  And the kitchen was also extremely tight so that it seemed as though they could only handle a few dishes at a time.  As a result, there was a pretty significant wait to get our food, largely because we were there at a time where every table was completely full and all of the orders came in within a narrow window.

That being said, though, the food was excellent and you can't beat the location or convenience to the theatre.  I would definitely recommend it and would go again, but more likely I would wait until the warmer weather to do so.

data.title: Convenient and OK
data.text: Close to Hanover Theatre.  Staff seemed pleasant but too busy-  EXTREMELY slow service, very cramped seating,  freezing cold every time the door is opened, not much atmosphere, food just OK.  Perhaps we hit it on a bad night, since other reviews seem more positive. I think there may be seating in another room and that may be more comfortable.

owner_response.author: jeanette h, Owner at Theatre Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry you didn't have a pleasant dining experience with us. Yes, we are a tiny place. The majority of our customers enjoy the coziness of our atmosphere...I'm sorry you did not. As to the speed of the service, we did have a new waitress training with us that evening so yes, there was a learning curve happening. It is also noted on our website how you will not receive your meal as quick as a larger restaurant as we have the one chef and not 10......which is good since we are so small. If I recall correctly, you had more then enough time to make it to the show with plenty of minutes to spare. You didn't mention what you had for dinner that was "just OK" but I'm going to guess you had appetizers as you dinner....mini crab cakes & bruschetta. I'm sorry you did not enjoy them.  Lastly, it is Winter in New England so yes it is cold outside...and yes, the door does have to open to let in all the customers that join us. I'm sorry you were uncomfortable. We strive to make sure everyone that dines with us has a pleasant experience I'm sorry we let you down.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful and quant!
data.text: My friend and I had a fabulous dinner last night before our theater performance. This little find is very tiny but has superior food and atmosphere.  Quality food for a reasonable price they have a set menu for performance nights to make it easier on the kitchen. But there is quite a variety to choose from. We both had the rack of lamb which was cooked to perfection as were the sides of potatoes and green beans. The Caesar salad was top notch. The staff makes you feel like family. You are in a very small space see you get to know your neighboring tables quite well. Fortunately for us we had a fabulous people around us and all of us are going to the same performance so we had quite a bit to talk about.  The staff was great - met all our needs.

owner_response.author: jeanette h, Owner at Theatre Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your kind review! Glad you enjoyed your dinner and we hope to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food
data.text: I love the location of being close to qcc. Great place for lunch :) you can call ahead too. The only downfall is I wish they opened earlier (before classes start) would love to breakfast./coffee

owner_response.author: jeanette h, Owner at Theatre Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the great review! I'm not sure what time your classes start in the morning but we open at 8am....so if that works, come on in and grab some breakfast before you go!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Europe in America
data.text: We visited on a Wednesday night prior to going to the Hanover Theater for a play. Reservations are recommended for this small mom & pop place. The atmosphere, while not elaborate is European. The food is great. My wife and I have the Rack of Lamb which consisted of 4 chops. The chops were very thick and meaty and perfectly prepared, nice and pink inside. They were wonderful. Our companion had the lobster ravioli which were stuffed with ravioli and delicious.The owners are very amicable and will do everything possible to make your dinning experience enjoyable.  We immediately made reservations for our next play. The place is BYOB and they will supply the glasses and ice cheerfully.  You must visit here.

data.title: Mike Pellegrino
data.text: The Theater café is the best kept secret in downtown Worcester. The food was delicious and can be ranked right among the five star restaurants in Worcester. The food is always fresh and the meals will dance on your taste buds. The prime rib will just melt in your mouth.The service was delightful and very attentive. You will not leave disappointed.

data.title: Good food not so much staff
data.text: I usually go in to buy their burgers which are really good but it's just every time I go in, I don't receive any good friendly service. Not sure why that is because most commenters here say they are nice but I get some attitude even when I'm being a friendly customer. I go in when they are the only one open on the weekends and go for lunch but after these visits, not coming back. Need to be more friendlier to everyone.

owner_response.author: jeanette h, Owner at Theatre Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Jenny, thank you for taking the time to write a review. I am happy to hear that you enjoy our burger but not happy to hear you received unfriendly service. We strive to provide a level of service that is positive, happy and fun. We at the Cafe like to make everyone that visits us feel as they are a part of our family but it seems we let you down. And for that I am sorry. 

I sent you a private message but did not receive a response so I hope you will see this. I hope you visit us again and let us show you how truly nice we really are! All these other reviews can't be that wrong.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: surprisingly good food
data.text: This is a very small spot in downtown Worcester, an area that has clearly seen better days. However this little cafe is a perfect spot for lunch. It was very crowded the day we were there because of a showing of The Christmas Carol at the theater down the street. We ended up sharing a table which was fine because the place has the feel of a neighborhood spot where people know each other. We had cheeseburgers with fries, pretty standard fare, but these were large beautiful burgers, done exactly as ordered and the fries were good too. The prices are remarkably low as well. We left feeling well fed and happy.

data.title: Tiny but mighty!
data.text: Many places say "homemade" but this time I am sure it's the truth! I could see the chef making green beans on a small grill right behind the counter, and my companion loved them (and she said she doesn't usually even eat them!) I had turkey rice soup, brimming with flavor and chunks of white and dark meat, and mussels in a delectable broth. The atmosphere is homey and comfortable, with everyone on staff doing their best to please the customer. I will be back!

data.title: Great local lunch and dinner spot
data.text: This place has the best food - home cooked by a wife and husband team. The dishes are creative and delicious. I love coming her for lunch and even for dinner, especially before a show at the hanover. Go in and experience the owners! They are great.

data.title: Very pleased we found it.
data.text:
Looked on Yelp when we were looking for a place close by - chose this when I saw the reviews were good.  I never expect too much but was really please.  I had a terrific duck sausage, mushroom omelet.  Really outstanding.  The kids got pancakes and I had to ask the chef about them they were so great. (Pancakes for me are usually meh)   Handmade from scratch - no mix. 
The prices were really reasonable - especially considering the ingredients and time to prepare.  
Cons - coffee was just ok.

data.title: Did I miss something?
data.text: Went strictly based on reviews and was stunned. Sure, it's a cute little dive in a funky part of town and the staff was super friendly, but the food was average. There was little uniqueness in the sandwiches. They lacked flavor- burger wS decent but average roll, no tomato and 1 sprig of lettuce- I have had better lunches in Worcester. Very underwhelming which really disappointed me based on the reviews.

owner_response.author: jeanette h, Owner at Theatre Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry you didn't like the sandwiches you received. Please let me know what you ordered so I may be able to stop another flavorless sandwich from going out. As far as the burger is concerned...tomato is not an ingredient on our burger. Our menu does list all the items on each sandwich....burger included. We would have been more than happy to add a slice or two of tomato to your burger.  Next time you are in town, stop by and give us another try. If you are underwhelmed again let me know and I will be more than happy to refund your money.  Hope to see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food, amazing hosts
data.text:
I visited here recently. The food was great and it's location is very central.
Unfortunately I parked across the street in a parking lot that required a permit. 20 minutes later, my car was towed with my phone in it. The owners were SO empathetic -I won't go into details but they really went above and beyond to help me get my rental car back. I was in a new place with no phone and their calm and helpful demeanor was so appreciated. Thank you all very much for turning a bad situation into something much more manageable. - From the land of free parking.
